channel.title: Comparative studies on Political Science Research Methods
channel.description: Recent content in Comparative studies on Political Science Research Methods

item.title: Q&A Week 7: Comparative Studies
item.description: Table of Contents Can you explain more about the connection between Mill’s method of difference and experiments? Is the concern for external validity problems only apply to method of difference, or method of agreement as well? Is selecting on dependent variable only a problem for method of agreement? The lecture mentioned that method of difference has trouble estimating “multiple causes”. What are some examples of “multiple causes” cases?
